_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PRODUCERS COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE, PROCESSING, FEED PRODUCTION, SEED CLEANING AS WELL AS PROVIDING CUSTOMERS WITH FERTILIZER FOR AGRICULTURAL IMPUTS.

OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT CONSIST OF 2-18,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A  CAPACITY OF 158,000 POUNDS.  OUR NURSE TANK FLEET CONSIST OF 42 TOTAL TANKS AND HAS A CAPACITY OF AN ADDITIONAL 225,000 POUNDS.   BOTH OF THESE TOGETHER, POTENTIALLY GIVES US A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 383,000 POUNDS OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 79,000 POUNDS WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 1.89 MILES THAT HAS THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT 700 AREA RESIDENTS.  OTHER PUBLIC RECEPTORS INCLUDE A NURSING HOME, SCHOOL AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES.  THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE WOULD HAVE A TRANSFER HOSE FAILURE RELEASING NEARLY 12,000 POUNS OF NH3 WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .83 MILES AND COULD AFFECT 30 AREA CITIZENS.

OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED ANNUALLY IN THE PROPER PROCEDURES OF WORKING WITH AMMONIA INCLUDING MAINTENANCE AND STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES.  OUR WORKERS ARE TRAINED TO IDENTIFY SPECIFIC HAZARDS AND HOW TO DEAL WITH ANHYDROUS AMMONIA RELEASES.  EMPLOYEES ALWAYS  WEAR THE PROPER PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT SUCH AS GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURINGTHE NURSE TANK FILLING PROCESS.  WE ALWAYS  INSURE THAT CLEAN SAFETY WATER IS AVAILABLE DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS.  

THE PLANT IS INSPECTED BY THE STATE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE EACH YEAR AND WE ALWAYS COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUEST FOR ADDED IMPROVEMENTS.  WE ADHERE TO ALL FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL RULES AND REGULATIONS REGARDING THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA PLANT.  AT THE PRESENT TIME, WE DO NOT EXPECT TO MAKE ANY ADDITIONAL SAFETY CHANGES IN EQUIPMENT.  IF THE NEED ARISES, WE'LL DO SO ONLY WHEN THE BUDGET ALLOWS. 

ALL OF THE ABOVE MENTIONED PROCEDURES ALLOWS THIS COMPANY TO REPORT THAT NO ACCIDENTS HAVE OCCURRED WITHIN THE LAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAVE CAUSED HUMAN INJURY OR PROPERTY DAMAGE.

THIS COMPANY'S  E

MERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND THEY'VE BEEN PROVIDED WITH AN EDUCATIONAL TOUR OF OUR FACILITY.  THEY'VE ALSO AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OR EMERGENCY SITUATION.
